did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.origination: King and Queen County (Va.) Circuit Court.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: King and Queen County (Va.) Records, 1719-1867. Local government records collection, King and Queen County Court Records. The Library of Virginia, Richmond, Va. 23219.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: These items came to the Library of Virginia in a shipment of court papers from King and Queen County. Portions of the collection were transferred under the following accession numbers: 23776, 24802, 25329, 25453, 27028, 29492, 42644.

bioghist.head: Historical Information
bioghist.p: King and Queen County was named for William III and Mary II, who were called to the English throne in 1688. It was formed from New Kent County in 1691.
King and Queen County court records were lost in courthouse fires in 1828 and 1833. Records were destroyed by a courthouse fire set by Union Troups on 10 March 1864 during the Civil War.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: King and Queen County (Va.) Records, 1719-1867, includes miscellaneous records from the following series: County Administrative Records, Sheriff's Records, Court Records, and Land Records.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Additional King and Queen County Court Records can be found on microfilm at the Library of Virginia. Consult "A Guide to Virginia County and City Records on Microfilm"

King and Queen County is one of Virginia's Lost Records Localities. Additional King and Queen Court Records may be found in the Virginia Lost Records Localities Collection at the Library of Virginia. Search the Lost Records Localities Database found at the Library of Virginia's web site.

controlaccess.head: Corporate Names:
controlaccess.corpname: King and Queen County (Va.) Circuit Court

controlaccess.head: Genre and Form Terms:
controlaccess.genreform: Local government records--Virginia--King and Queen County

scopecontent.p: Sheriff's Tax Assessors Book, 1841-1842 (Accession 23776); Sheriff's Tax Account Book, 1821 (Accession 27028); Declaration of Complaint, 1867 (Accession 29492)

Capias and 3 Certificates; Deed, 1719 and copy of the Deed (Accession 24802); 1 Deed from Dickey Shepherd to Robert B. Semple, 1810 (Accession 42644); 3 Deeds, 1840, 1855, 1858, and Plat, undated, (Accession 25453) and Deed, 1850 (Accession 25329)
